attributes.action: Formerly apologize to Dennis Skinner for being unfairly ejected.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201213/cmstords/614/body.htm

He was ejected under Standing order 43 - "The Speaker, or the chair, shall order any Member or Members whose conduct is grossly disorderly to withdraw immediately from the House during the remainder of that day’s sitting; " . He was not grossly disorderly, and I'm pretty sure he was just asking the same questions that most of the British Public want to know aswell.
attributes.background: On 11/04/16 Dennis Skinner was ejected simply for calling David Cameron "Dodgy Dave". David Cameron can accuse others of being "Terrorist Sympathizers" and yet not a problem?

rejection.details:
Any decision to apologise would be a personal decision by the Speaker, and not the responsibility of the Government or of the House of Commons as a whole.

If you would like Standing Order No. 43 to be changed, you could start a petition calling for that.
